content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Articles cover basic employee record creation and filtering. PRD V2.1 enriches with bulk viewing (up to 500 employees), global search via CMD/CTRL+K, recently viewed tracking, and role/department column visibility. Navigation map confirms primary entry points.
Article covers uploading and tracking company-level documents (trade licenses, policies) with expiry dates. Distinct from employee documents; focuses on organizational compliance.

Three articles cover MFA lifecycle: activation (download Google Authenticator, scan QR, verify code), login with MFA, and deactivation (verify with code). All personas can configure MFA in their security settings.

Article provides step-by-step EOS workflow. PRDs add automation details: gratuity formula (MOL standard or custom), leave encashment integration, loan deduction handling, prorated salary calculation, and non-AED employee rules (zero gratuity). Finance managers and HR admins execute this workflow.
Article describes recording and tracking company assets assigned to employees, including serial number, type, brand, model, status (working/damaged/in-repair), purchase date, and office location.

Merged bulk upload workflow with individual employee profile management and global search capabilities. PRD 2091614278 enriches with pagination, CMD/CTRL+K search, and recently viewed/searched features.

Article covers document viewing, filtering, and reminders. PRD 3535699999 adds custom document type configuration, expiry tracking, and automated reminders. PRD 3375267883 adds permission controls for document editing/deletion with approval workflows.
Consolidated company logo upload, company documents/letters management, and career page setup into single settings workflow.
Merged office location assignment (manual and bulk methods) with company asset tracking and management.
Single article on bank account management for payroll processing with Trade License association.
Three articles consolidated: initial invite workflow, invite management (resend/delete/search), and error correction (wrong email). Unified into single task covering full invitation lifecycle.
Single article on announcement creation, publishing, and management with draft capability.

Article provides org chart visualization workflow; PRD enriches with employee list improvements (500 employee display, global search via CMD/CTRL+K, recently viewed/searched employees, role/department columns).
Single article on custom employee groups with automatic/manual grouping and role-based viewership permissions for payroll data.
Single article on Google Fit integration for employee wellness data sync via Bayzat mobile app.
Grouped tickets related to employee profile form interactions, validation timing, and save functionality issues. All affect data entry workflow.
Grouped tickets related to work location field limitations, city/location data constraints, and field naming issues. All affect employee setup and geographic data management.
Grouped tickets related to advanced filtering and custom data support in reporting. Both affect analytics and reporting workflows.
Grouped tickets related to data recovery capabilities and IBAN lookup functionality. Both affect troubleshooting and data management workflows.
Grouped tickets related to UI layout, navigation placement, responsive design, and interface organization. All affect user experience across employee profile and related modules.

Grouped tickets addressing document lifecycle management, expiry notifications, document relationships, and editing restrictions. Merged duplicate PHP-to-Kotlin migration tickets (AV-1416, AV-1433) into single limitation.
Grouped tickets addressing leave balance adjustments, negative balance support, and leave record visibility after policy changes.

product_context.title: PRD: Employee Records V2.1
product_context.why_built: Improve employee list management for companies with large workforces. Admins can view up to 500 employees at once (instead of 10), use global search accessible via CMD/CTRL+K from anywhere in the product, see recently viewed employees and recent searches for quick access, and view additional employee data points (role, department) directly in the list.
key_design_decisions: Configurable rows per page (10/25/50/100/250/500) to control display density
Global search accessible via CMD/CTRL+K keyboard shortcut from anywhere in product
Recently viewed employees (up to 5) and recent searches (up to 5) for quick access patterns
Employee list displays name, role, and department columns for better context
Edit icon removed from employee table rows
Circle with initials retained for employee avatars
UAE-specific fields (Residence Visa Location, Trade License, MOL No.) only shown when Legal Country of Residence is UAE
Maximum 500 employees displayed per page with configurable rows per page (10/25/50/100/250/500)
Recently viewed shows maximum 5 profiles; recent searches shows maximum 5 terms
Maximum 500 employees displayed per page to support large organizations
Hide recently viewed and recent searches sections when empty to reduce clutter

product_context.title: PRD: Employee Documents
product_context.why_built: Enhance employee document management to meet compliance, business, and legal requirements. Enable creation and configuration of custom document types with expiry tracking and automated reminders. Allow HR to manage the complete document lifecycle from pre-hire through exit. Provide timely expiry notifications so managers can proactively initiate document renewals and maintain compliance.
key_design_decisions: Custom document type configuration with 2-70 character names (Arabic supported)
Mandatory/non-mandatory flag for each document type
Expiry date toggle with configurable reminder timing (1-12 months before expiry)
Default reminder set to 7 months before expiry for Passport, Residency Visa, Emirates ID
'Others' document type special handling: Expiry toggle locked to TRUE but expiry date not required, mandatory status cannot be changed
Emirates ID: Both front and back have same fields with quick action to copy details between front/back
Automated email reminders to stakeholders for proactive document renewal
Document collection starts before employee joins and continues through exit
'Others' document type has special handling: Expiry toggle locked to TRUE, mandatory status non-editable
Emirates ID supports both old and new formats with quick action to copy details between front/back
Automated email reminders sent to stakeholders at configured intervals
Document types sorted using same logic as Company documents
Document name validation: 2-70 characters, supports Arabic for multi-language support
Expiry reminders configurable 1-12 months before expiry to accommodate different document types

product_context.title: Opportunity Assessment and Solution Space - End of service
product_context.why_built: Enable HR Admin and Finance Managers to calculate final settlement for end of service efficiently within Bayzat, replacing time-consuming Excel-based processes. Automate gratuity calculations with accurate formulas and integrate leave/attendance data automatically.
key_design_decisions: Auto-collect contract info (hire date, contract type) from employee records
Pull pay data (salary, expenses, loans) from payroll module
Calculate leave encashment and unpaid leave deductions from time-off data
Apply gratuity formula (MOL standard or custom per free zone)
Handle non-AED employees with zero gratuity calculation
Support partial years of service and mid-month departures
Allow custom gratuity calculations with admin remark
Integrate with Payroll, Time Off, Attendance, Loans, and Employee Records modules

product_context.title: PRD: End of Service Calculation
product_context.why_built: Enable finance managers to calculate and settle employee final settlements when leaving the company, including gratuity calculation, leave encashment, outstanding loans, and prorated salary. Automate confusing EOS calculations based on service duration, departure reason, and contract type.
key_design_decisions: End of Service tab in employee payroll profile for easy access
Auto-calculate gratuity based on MOL formula with override capability
Fetch leave balance and encashment from time-off data
Include outstanding loans and recurring deductions
Calculate prorated salary based on departure date
Support both limited and unlimited contract types
Restrict salary configuration editing once departure date is set
Submit EOS only when departure date is past or current month

product_context.title: Opportunity Assessment: Employee profile improvements
product_context.why_built: Give HR administrators control over employee profile data integrity through three improvements: (1) Allow admins to upload employee profile photos when employees don't add them, (2) Configure permissions to restrict employee editing of documents, personal/work info, and dependent data—addressing issues with larger organizations where employees mess up sensitive data, (3) Customize employee directory fields to show relevant information like country of residence and manager for remote team collaboration.
key_design_decisions: Admin photo upload capability on employee profile with override functionality
Permission configuration for document add/edit/delete, personal info editing, work info editing, dependent info editing
Approval workflow for document and payment detail changes with email notifications
Employee directory customization with Country of Residence and Manager fields
Support for both Mobile and Web platforms
Arabic translation for all permission-related communications
Change request history tracking for audit purposes

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system enforces hire date validation at the page load stage, preventing users from accessing the Leave page in employee profiles even when they only intend to view information. Validation should be deferred until specific actions like policy configuration are attempted.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Employee Profile Save & Avatar Upload Performance
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Employee Profile Work tab save button lacks robust input validation and does not prevent incomplete data submission. Additionally, avatar upload processing is slow due to missing frontend optimization, and the system allows multiple concurrent save attempts without proper UI controls.

The work location dropdown is restricted to the company's registered country only, preventing multi-country organizations from managing employee locations across GCC or other regions. Additionally, the system cannot accommodate unofficial or emerging city names that lack government recognition, and the 'Title' field lacks proper job title semantics.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Platform architecture ties location data to company registration country for compliance and payroll accuracy

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform enforces strict validation preventing EOS calculations for dates before the first day of the previous closed payroll period, creating rigid constraints for backdated terminations. Additionally, gratuity amount and comment fields cannot be edited when the gratuity amount is zero, preventing necessary modifications during offboarding.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Payroll integrity requires EOS dates to align with closed payroll periods to prevent calculation conflicts

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks comprehensive company documents management capabilities including automated expiry date tracking, document lifecycle management, and email reminder systems for incomplete employee profiles. Users cannot sort, filter, or automatically manage documents based on expiration timelines, and HR administrators must manually track profile completion.

The payroll reporting module lacks advanced filtering capabilities that combine custom data filters using intersection (AND) logic, preventing precise employee filtering across organizational attributes. Additionally, AI Reports functionality does not support employee custom fields, preventing users from leveraging user-defined employee data in AI-generated reports.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Custom field support in AI Reports is technically challenging and not in near-term roadmap per engineering

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform has partial data recovery capabilities where deleted employee profiles can be retrieved but not all associated employee data can be restored, creating uncertainty and potential data loss risk. Additionally, the system lacks an automated IBAN lookup or verification tool, requiring manual investigation by development team to identify which employee profile is linked to a specific bank account.

The employee profile and related modules have multiple UI/UX issues: unnecessary dropzone areas in mandatory document sections create visual complexity, policy view functionality is not accessible from employee profile interface, responsive design constraints prevent proper table width rendering across screen sizes, and delete functionality placement does not match user expectations for employee profile management.

The document management system lacks granular start date tracking, flexible expiry notification mechanisms, and consistent document relationship maintenance. Users cannot receive customized expiry reminders beyond monthly automated emails, and document links are not automatically maintained when documents are replaced or edited. Additionally, document editing restrictions are inconsistently applied across different document types, and dependent document modifications lack nuanced controls based on policy stage or administrative preferences.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Users must manually re-establish document links after document changes and manage expiry notifications through external calendar systems.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Bulk Upload & Data Entry Validation Limitations
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The bulk upload system lacks comprehensive validation for employee records and payroll data. Job type/employment type fields are not available in bulk upload templates, preventing automated assignment during data import. The platform allows submission of incomplete data (blank account numbers, MoL IDs) without contextual validation. Error messaging for document uploads lacks clarity—specifically, the 5MB file size limit is not clearly communicated to users, resulting in confusing error messages. Additionally, role management through Excel exports/imports is restricted, limiting HR administrators' ability to manage complex employee role structures via bulk operations.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: HR Admins must manually enter job types and roles through the UI after bulk upload, and must validate data externally before upload to catch missing required fields.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The leave management system lacks the capability to manually adjust leave balances, preventing HR from handling complex leave scenarios that require balance modifications or negative balance support. Additionally, when an employee is removed from a leave policy, previously created leave records are not consistently displayed or persisted across different views, creating data visibility inconsistencies.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: End of Service (EOS) Settlement Automation Gaps
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The EOS calculation framework is incomplete and requires manual intervention for service termination compensation calculations. The system cannot comprehensively handle complex entitlement rules and service period tracking. Additionally, users lack a self-service mechanism to reopen or reverse finalized EOS settlements—they must rely on backend support to delete and recalculate transactions manually through the admin panel.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Contact backend support to manually delete and recalculate EOS transactions through the admin panel.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The employee profile city dropdown for Saudi Arabia is incomplete, lacking several important regional cities, preventing users from accurately representing their employees' locations. Additionally, certain language translations may not automatically populate during company onboarding, requiring manual intervention or specific deployment configurations.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Manually configure missing cities and translations post-deployment or contact support for deployment-specific configuration.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform allows mentioning inactive or off-boarded employees in comments, which creates potential confusion and inappropriate interaction scenarios. Additionally, the system allows work email changes for registered users, which could compromise data consistency and user verification processes, representing a system-level validation weakness in employee record management.

The Employee Documents dashboard widget lacks a consistent loading state, creating an inconsistent user experience where widget loading states are not standardized across the platform. The employee profile work tab had translation rendering issues in the Ember frontend framework (now obsolete post-React migration). The document import interface has inconsistent handling of page states during file deletion, particularly when removing files from the last page or managing document lists.
The platform has a technical constraint preventing successful Excel file generation and download in the View Team Page, impacting users' ability to export and analyze team data efficiently.
